001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.optimizer.UpdateStep;
008
009/**
010 * Defines an optimization algorithm for training an {@link EstimationFunction}.
011 *
012 * <p>
013 * An {@code Optimizer} updates the parameters of an estimation function
014 * (e.g., a machine learning model) to minimize an {@link ObjectiveFunction}
015 * when applied to a given {@link DataSet}.
016 * </p>
017 *
018 * <p>
019 * Different optimizers implement different update rules (e.g., gradient descent,
020 * stochastic gradient descent, Adam). This interface abstracts those details
021 * to allow interchangeable use of optimizers in training regimes.
022 * </p>
023 *
024 * @param <E> the type of estimation function being optimized
025 * @see EstimationFunction
026 * @see ObjectiveFunction
027 * @see DataSet
028 */
029@DomainObject
030@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
031public interface Optimizer<E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> {
032
033    /**
034     * An {@link Optimizer} variant that is restricted to online (sample-by-sample)
035     * optimization.
036     *
037     * <p>
038     * Implementations of {@code OnlineOnly} optimize the estimation function one
039     * sample at a time rather than processing the entire dataset in a batch.
040     * This is common in streaming or online learning contexts.
041     * </p>
042     *
043     * <p>
044     * The default {@link #optimize(TrainableFunction, DataSet, ObjectiveFunction, int)}
045     * implementation iterates through the dataset and delegates to
046     * {@link #optimize(TrainableFunction, DataSet.Sample, ObjectiveFunction, int)} for
047     * each sample.
048     * </p>
049     *
050     * @param <E> the type of estimation function being optimized
051     */
052    @Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
053    interface Stochastic<E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> extends Optimizer<E, N> {
054
055        /**
056         * Default implementation of batch optimization for {@code OnlineOnly}
057         * optimizers. Iterates over the dataset and delegates optimization to
058         * the per-sample method.
059         *
060         * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to optimize
061         * @param trainingSet        the dataset used for optimization
062         * @param objective          the objective function that defines the loss
063         *                           and parameterGradients
064         */
065        @Override
066        default void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, int step) {
067            trainingSet.forEach(s -> optimize(estimationFunction, s, objective, step));
068        }
069
070        /**
071         * Optimizes the given estimation function using a single sample
072         * and the specified objective function.
073         *
074         * <p>
075         * Implementations typically calculate the gradient of the loss function
076         * for the given sample and update the parameters of the estimation function
077         * immediately, enabling online or stochastic optimization.
078         * </p>
079         *
080         * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to optimize
081         * @param sample             the training sample used for optimization
082         * @param objective          the objective function that defines the loss
083         *                           and parameterGradients
084         */
085        void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet.Sample<N> sample, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, int step);
086
087    }
088
089    static <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> Optimizer<E, N> nullOptimizer() {
090        return (estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, step) -> {
091        };
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Optimizes the given estimation function based on the entire training set
096     * and the specified objective function.
097     *
098     * <p>
099     * Typical implementations evaluate the {@link ObjectiveFunction} across the
100     * training set, compute parameterGradients, and update the parameters of the
101     * estimation function accordingly.
102     * </p>
103     *
104     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to optimize
105     * @param trainingSet        the dataset used for optimization
106     * @param objective          the objective function that defines the loss
107     *                           and parameterGradients
108     */
109    void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, int step);
110
111}
